result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Delfino Ponce Osorio was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs.
AMENDED 06-07-2016:  Apply 415 days sentence credit.

superMiscConds.notes: Fine to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision. Court ordered financial obligations and restitution payable out of 25% of inmate's funds while incarcerated.

Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for City of Brookfield Police Dept.
Costs to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.

No association with any known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed. No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol, (ie. bars, taverns, or liquor stores). Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. IID to be installed for the period of Extended Supervision. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by agent.  Court waives DNA Specimen, already compelted. Surcharge is imposed. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

records.addlTxt:
Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Delfino  Ponce Osorio in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.  

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 1.
Count 2 is dismissed by operation of law.
Defendant's employer presented a statement to the court.
Defendant's ex-wife presented a statement to the court.
Defendant presented statements to the court.


Court orders the following:
Total Prison:  5 Years.
Initial Confinement:  2 Years.
Extended Supervision:  3 Years.
415 Days Credit.

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 
 
36  Months D/L REVOCATION
36  Months IGNITION INTERLOCK

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Ignition Interlock Device installed for the period of probation.  
Do not drive or operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35 (to be forward to City of Brookfield Police Department);
FINE:  $3,039
DNA Sample - Court Waives - Already Provided.
DNA Surcharge: $250
To be paid as a Condition of the Sentence (can be taken out of prison wages/trust accounts).

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Defendant remanded to the custody of the Waukesha County Sheriff's Department.
Defendant to be transferred to DCI - FORTHWITH.
